Cathie Wood's Ark Invest ซื้อหุ้นคริปโตเพิ่มเติมในช่วงตลาดขาลง

Cathie Wood’s Ark Invest Loads Up on Crypto Stocks Amid Market Slump

2d ago//Mandy Williams
general
AI

Summary

TH

แคธี วูด (Cathie Wood) และ Ark Invest ใช้โอกาสจากตลาดคริปโตที่ลดลงเพื่อเพิ่มการลงทุนให้มากขึ้น บริษัทได้ใช้งบประมาณกว่า 19 ล้านดอลลาร์สหรัฐในวันที่ 3 กุมภาพันธ์ โดยซื้อหุ้นของบริษัทที่เกี่ยวข้องกับคริปโต เช่น Circle, Coinbase, Bullish, Bitmine, Block Inc. และ Robinhood การซื้อครั้งนี้เป็นส่วนหนึ่งของการซื้อหุ้นรวมมูลค่า 71 ล้านดอลลาร์ในวันก่อนหน้า แม้ว่า Bitcoin จะลดลงต่ำกว่า 90,000 ดอลลาร์และมีความเสี่ยงในการตกต่ำลงไปอีกถึง 60,000 ดอลลาร์ แต่ Ark Invest ยังคงดำเนินการซื้ออย่างต่อเนื่องผ่าน ETF ต่างๆ ซึ่งแสดงถึงความเชื่อมั่นในระยะยาวในภาคคริปโต

EN

Cathie Wood's Ark Invest is capitalizing on the bearish crypto market by significantly increasing its holdings of crypto-related stocks. The firm has spent over $19 million on February 3 alone, acquiring shares in companies like Circle, Coinbase, Bullish, Bitmine, Block Inc., and Robinhood. These purchases follow an even larger $71 million acquisition made the previous day. Despite Bitcoin falling below $90,000 and facing potential further decline, Ark Invest continues its buying spree through various ETFs, demonstrating a long-term confidence in the crypto sector.

Key Points

  • Ark Invest is increasing crypto stock holdings during a market downturn
  • Recent purchases total over $19 million on Feb 3 and $71 million on the previous day
  • Companies bought include Circle, Coinbase, Bullish, Bitmine, Block Inc., and Robinhood
  • Bitcoin is below $90,000 with potential to fall to $60,000
  • Ark Invest continues buying despite market conditions, showing long-term confidence in crypto

Article

The Tuesday purchases followed a heavier round of acquisitions on Monday, during which Ark Invest loaded up on crypto-related shares worth more than $71 million. The broader digital asset market is in a bearish state, but some experts are leveraging the dip to expand their crypto exposure. Cathie Wood’s investment management company, Ark Invest, is one of them, having scooped up thousands of shares linked to crypto firms over the last few trading days. According to the latest trade filing from Ark Invest, the firm spent over $19 million to purchase additional crypto-related stocks through its exchange-traded funds (ETFs) on February 3. The acquired shares are tied to multiple companies, including the stablecoin issuer Circle, crypto exchanges Coinbase and Bullish, and Ethereum treasury firm Bitmine. Ark Invest Buys Crypto Stocks On Tuesday, Ark Invest bought 145,488 Bitmine shares for $3.25 million and 125,218 Bullish shares for $3.46 million. In addition, the company purchased 42,878 Circle shares for $2.4 million and 3,510 Coinbase shares for $630,606. Notably, Ark Invest also tapped into the Bitcoin-focused tech entity Block Inc. and financial services firm Robinhood, buying shares totaling 31,202 and 89,677 for $1.77 million and $7.8 million, respectively. The Tuesday purchases followed a heavier round of acquisitions on Monday. Ark Invest had scooped up crypto-related shares worth more than $71 million. Similarly, the Monday buys included shares of Coinbase, Circle, Bitmine, Robinhood, Bullish, and Block Inc. The firm made these purchases through several ETFs, including ARK Blockchain & Fintech Innovation ETF (ARKF) and ARK Innovation ETF (ARKK). Market Crashes as BTC Declines Ever since bitcoin (BTC) began its descent late last year, crypto stocks have followed suit. Data from Trading View shows that the stocks of most crypto-related companies are down by double digits over the last three months. Their decline has intensified as BTC remains below $90,000 and faces the risk of plummeting under $60,000. At the time of writing, the leading digital asset was changing hands at $76,000, down 17% monthly and 14% weekly. While BTC and the broader market continue to decline, Ark Invest has been on a buying spree. The asset manager has spent millions of dollars on crypto-related stocks in December and January. From the look of things, the company is likely to continue buying crypto stocks for as long as the bearish season lasts.
